title: Tommaso Condulmier
text:
Tommaso Condulmier also spelled Condulmer, Gondulmier or Gondulmiero (<a href="Venice">Venice</a>, 20 August 1759 - <a href="Venice">Venice</a>, 7 January 1823) was an Italian <a href="nobility">noble</a> and <a href="admiral">admiral</a>. After the death of <a href="Angelo%20Emo">Angelo Emo</a> he took command of the <a href="Venetian%20Navy">Armada Grossa</a>, and held major responsibilities in the aborted defense of Venice against <a href="Napoleon">Napoleon</a>, that eventually led to the <a href="fall%20of%20the%20Republic%20of%20Venice">fall of the Republic of Venice</a> in <a href="1797">1797</a>.
Biography.
Born in <a href="Venice">Venice</a> from a noble family that held the <a href="Patrician%20%28post-Roman%20Europe%29">patrician</a> dignity, he enlisted at an early age in the <a href="Venetian%20Navy">navy</a>.
In June <a href="1784">1784</a>, when <a href="Angelo%20Emo">Emo</a> launched his campaign against the Berber pirates, he was "governator di nave" (captain) on the 56-gun heavy frigate <a href="San%20Michiel%20Arcangelo-class%20heavy%20frigate">"Concordia"</a> stationed in <a href="Corf%C3%B9">Corfù</a>: after the arrival of the venetian <a href="Grand%20Admiral">Grand Admiral</a> on the island, he was put under his command, and eventually set sails for <a href="Tunis">Tunis</a> with the Venetian squadron.
